website_summaries.verdict: One of the smallest smart guitars on the market that you can travel with. Perfect for those energetic traveling guitarists headed to gigs or just for practicing.
pros: Lightweight compared to most guitars, with an overall weight  less than 3 pounds
A traveling guitar player's dream instrument
Offers nice tone when played through your smart device
Enjoyable to play just about anywhere
cons: Hard to fit into some book bags, as well as suitcases
Strings may feel tight for some players

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with this travel-friendly guitar
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with this travel friendly guitar. After having tried Yamaha Guitalele and FG Jr. Guitars while traveling, business and personal, I was surprised to find this product which provides a full-size neck and decent tone through your mobile device. I connect my Traveler through an IPod, or IPhone, with Amplitube and sometimes GarageBand. Amplitube provides a range of virtual amps for more choices to shape your sound, I usually use my Traveler for either practice (Yousician) and songwriting. I've not yet tried recording with it, anyway highly recommend this instrument for guitarists requiring a highly portable full size acoustic-electric, this fits easily within most luggage too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Han

customer_reviews.title: Defective output jack
customer_reviews.text: Need a lefty practice guitar and this looked perfect. Ordered the lefty Ultra-Light and received a righty. The box was labeled worth th lefty model # but had a right in it. Not sure who was at fault here Amazon or Traveler. I sent it back and got the correct replacement guitar. After using it a few times the output jack failed. Removed the rear cover and noticed one of the wires had broken at the soldering point. Not really worth spending the shipping cost or time for warranty repair so I’ll attempt to resolder it myself. Other than these issues I really like the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: GTS

customer_reviews.title: A Real Instrument, not a toy. Shockingly small, extremely well made, amazingly playable. Get one.
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly high quality overall, mine came with near-perfect intonation right through the 21st fret. It was practically still in tune when I pulled it out of the FedEx box, which says a lot about how well it will travel! The construction quality of a performance-grade instrument, the feel and playability of the neck are very similar to my Baby Taylor, which is in the same price range. The neck will never come loose because the whole thing is one piece of wood. It has an actual adjustable truss rod. The tuners work beautifully, and are inherently well-protected so they won't get whacked. This is a REAL INSTRUMENT, not a toy, and a brilliant design.
customer_reviews.author: T. T.

customer_reviews.title: This little guitar is perfect for travel!
customer_reviews.text: I am relatively new to playing guitar and looked for something i could take with me when camping or traveling so I can continue to practice. This is small and rugged so I don't have to worry about damaging my full-size acoustic. Since it does not have a hollow body, it is very quiet which is perfect for hotels or staying with family. I have a small amp to use if i want to generate full sound. The action is nice and it's generally fun to play. I would recommend this to anyone who travels and wants to keep practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: One of my all-time best guitar purchases
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, clever design, and stays in tune! I rarely plug it in....unplugged sounds like your normal electric guitar unplugged. An absolute breeze to travel with....fits under seat on plane (and it's light!). The little neck loop allows me to hang it on a door...makes you want to play it every time you walk by. Saw a few YouTube reviews of it and figured why not...so glad I purchased it (on Amazon). Bought it August 2018 and play it almost every day....ideal for when you don't want to wake family late at night! Way superior than most of the travel-size guitars I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: CTD

customer_reviews.title: Love this guitar for travelling!
customer_reviews.text: I usually play a full size acoustic guitar so it takes a little getting used to. It is perfect for travelling as It fits in the overhead bin of most aircrafts. I practice with it in my hotel room, usually without any connection to headphones or speaker, I can hear it just fine and I don't disturb any of my neighbors with it. I now don't miss any practice time when I travel it's great and I have recommended it to several of my fellow musicians.
customer_reviews.author: Bdavil01

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying on Planes
customer_reviews.text: Been carrying this guitar on planes since I got it. Never a problem. Excellent in the hotel room using the small amp hooked to my headset. Never had anyone complaint about my playing. Really great guitar. I would definitely buy it again. I got the acoustic, but now I'm thinking about the electric as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cubes58

customer_reviews.title: i do like it.
customer_reviews.text: It's adequate for the purpose I bought it (practicing in the passenger seat of the car on long trips). 4 stars instead of 5 because it's a pain in the butt to tune, due to the location of the tuners, and because calling it an "acoustic" is a bit misleading, since it puts out no more sound than an uplugged electric guitar if not plugged into an amp. However, i do like it.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic travel guitar. It is perfect for air travel and practicing in hotel rooms. As has been said in other reviews, a strap is a must. The leg rest doesn't keep the guitar stable by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R Carroll

customer_reviews.title: A pretty basic guitar, but portability is awesome
customer_reviews.text: You could probably buy a better electric guitar with controls for the money, but the portability of this guitar is genius. It does seem to lose tuning pretty easy, but I'm still a huge fan. The action is nice and the sound is decent. It's too small to fit in carry on bags, but I can lug it around or drop it in a larger checked bag.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design, great guitar for learning
customer_reviews.text: I got this guitar because I like the compact design, and I needed a quiet guitar while I learn to play. I have been very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: futurefan

customer_reviews.title: Really cool, really small, sounds great, looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: This guitar looks really weird, but it's really pretty too. I love mine, and everyone that's seen it had to try it and all claim that it plays like a champ! I can't give a great musical review as I got it to learn on, but it feels good to me, sounds good to me...I love it a lot. It just seems like a cool, useful guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne EMT-P

customer_reviews.title: Needs some adjustments
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to play without a strap. I tried to work something out but it's going to take some more time. No volume control is somewhat problematic but not a deal breaker. Like someone else said it would be better with regular strings. The fact that it's very light is a big plus for me. All in all not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.I.

customer_reviews.title: So far is great, but I am still learning
customer_reviews.text: So far is great, but I am still learning. The sound is very low. You need the little Amp to plug your ear buds or speaker to to really appropriate it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Moore

customer_reviews.title: 100% recomended
customer_reviews.text: the best guitar ever! The best sound for a recording studio... or playing live. 100% recomended
customer_reviews.author: Jean Quiñonez

customer_reviews.title: It serves the purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a driver who spends lots of hours on the road, so my practice time at home is very limited, I purchased this as a practice guitar while on the road and it serves the purpose. I really enjoy it and it didn’t sound bad at all when plugged to my amp.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Cure for My Guitar Addiction
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! LOVE IT! LOVE IT! I did have some concerned when I bought in how airport security would respond. However, there were no issues when I traveled with it. This is such a great instrument and serves as the cure for my addiction no matter where I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Christian

customer_reviews.title: guitar came with a wood dirty
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that the dirty guitar was sold as new and clean.
customer_reviews.author: jif

customer_reviews.title: I like the guitar itself
customer_reviews.text: I like the guitar itself. I took off one star as it offers to give an acoustic sound, which it does not. I am quite happy with what I got, although I find when I jump between my acoustic guitar and the traveler, it takes a bit to get used to the very different feels. Holding and playing the Traveler takes a little getting used to, but it has a great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact guitar that sounds decent
customer_reviews.text: This little guitar is very handy to travel with - or just practice scales on while watching TV. The plug-in leg rest is too slippery to be useful, but I found slipping a length of clear vinyl tubing over it solved my problem. Just wet the inside of the tubing with water first and you can slide it into place.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Harris

customer_reviews.title: I used it when I traveled to Australia. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it when I traveled to Australia. The only issue I had was that the metal leg-rest was slippery and the guitar was not stable on my leg. It was OK for a practice guitar, though.
customer_reviews.author: Promod R. Pratap

customer_reviews.title: NOT "acoustic" at all
customer_reviews.text: A really good instrument, the only down side being that the word "acoustic" should NOT be used at all, as it has zero reverberation qualities. It is a very good basic electric guitar, but not an "acoustic-electric" at all. If I'd known how poor the supposed "acoustic" part was, I'd not have bought it at all but would just have bought the actual Ultra-Light Electric with better pickups. Having said this, I love it, teamed up with a mini-amp (the full Electric would have been even better)
customer_reviews.author: Andy RockDr

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar after changing strings
customer_reviews.text: A high quality instrument but the strings that came with it were very noisy. I replaced the strings and the guitar now works great, so one star minus for the poor strings. Even so the body is very small it does play like a full size guitar, I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Wen and M

customer_reviews.title: it is light, however it is quite quiet, so definitely more an electric than acoustic.
customer_reviews.text: love it, full size fret board, m fits in my suitcase, what more do you need!
customer_reviews.author: verity brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the road
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my hectic traveling schedule. Easy to fit on a plane and allows me to practice in my hotel room without the fear of bothering folks in neighboring rooms.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great portable guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Convenient. Light. Easy to carry on an airplane. Cons: The bridge saddle needs to be adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri C.

customer_reviews.title: Real full size fret board.
customer_reviews.text: A strong intro to “silent” guitar practice. Freedom to play and practice anytime with a headphone amp.
customer_reviews.author: Philip N Loheed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel guitar!
customer_reviews.text: I have this as a present and she loved it! Played great, good sound and completely portable. Now she can take it anywhere she goes and practice! It is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for road warriors like me
customer_reviews.text: I take this little beauty on every business trip. Great for practicing. The only small complaint is that the 1/4 inch output plug, which doubles as a strap button, comes loose all the time and you have to take off the small metal plate on the back to tighten it again. Kind of a hassle. Maybe the manufacturer has a suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Hundeliebhaber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Very well made. Great for trips. Very nice quality and great tone.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: perfect for traveling and keeping the sound quiet in a ...
customer_reviews.text: This gift was for my husband and he LOVES it!! He is a pilot and the guitar is light and quiet...perfect for traveling and keeping the sound quiet in a hotel room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son. With the addition of a Pignose amplifier/speaker, it plays beautifully. He has a fantastic guitar made of rosewood that cost over $1,000 over twenty years ago on sale. He also has one of those travel guitars. Yet, he plays this one rather than the other two. In fact, his playing time has increased since getting this one. It plays like the big guys. Without an amp, it's very, very quiet -- only good enough for the player to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Harry E. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for a Musician Who Travels!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar for my boyfriend for Christmas. He is a pilot and travels a LOT. He is also a pretty good guitar player, but bemoans the fact that he can't practice when he's on the road. He absolutely loves this travel guitar. The size is super compact, but the neck is a full-size neck, so it feels as though you are playing a full-size guitar. It can be used with head phones or plugged into an amp. He appreciates quality, so the fact that he loves this item so much tells you something.
customer_reviews.author: Viola Woman

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: When I travel I carry this guitar with me and now I can practice a bit from wherever I am. I also bought the "Vox amPlug AC30 Guitar Headphone Amp". When I want to relax I turn on my phone and search for a backing track in Youtube, then I connect the phone to the Vox amPlug and I can have fun for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Castillo

customer_reviews.title: First travel guitar
customer_reviews.text: First time I have used a travel guitar. With it's light weight the balance is taking some getting used to, but it has a good fretboard and is structurally a good guitar. Holds tuning well.
customer_reviews.author: am gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Good travel guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel guitar, it is small and is sturdy built. Compared to the price range of what else is out there and the fact that I will primarily be traveling on an airplanes, this seemed the best choice, and it was! The only downside is the plug is right where your arm would rest on a typical guitar and whatever you plug in will get in the way. All in all I can not complain though, it is perfect for the frequent traveler in my opinion. You pretty much have to use a strap as well because this thing is so light it tends to move.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality fretboard
customer_reviews.text: Great quality fretboard, and sounds awesome - now, my rating is based upon if I actually like it, which I don't. It is very uncomfortable to play. I will probably sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Mickey Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good to practice but uncomfortable for the right arm. Very light which is very good to take with you in a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Iahnke Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Guitar
customer_reviews.text: This little piece of equipment is amazing. What a perfect tool to bring with you when you travel - fits in a suitcase or overhead... you can even break it out if you're solo in a two-seater row! I even use it while I'm just lying on the couch watching TV with my wife. Simply perfect to keep you practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely done.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made instrument. It's set up to go out of the box. Sounds and plays perfectly. A Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R. Garskof

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is and it's light! Nice for hotel practice
customer_reviews.text: Not very comfortable when on lap. However it's super easy /light to travel with and that's why I purchased it. Perfect for practicing chords and scales. Sounds ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastc
customer_reviews.text: This is a very clever and very well designed. Used with a set of active headphones the sound is incredible and annoys no one.. It keeps its tune well and it is well constructed. I live in Australia and it arrived within 3 days. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: IRB

customer_reviews.title: Traveler Guitar
customer_reviews.text: was a gift and he was exstatic.. so am I.. now I can sleep in peace and he can play all he wants and takes to work for down times to practice
customer_reviews.author: denise ethier

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little travel/practice guitar. The action is very good and the sound is too! Get it now!
customer_reviews.author: Kazman

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!! the piezos sound great, very unique. It is very light. If you purchase it, I would recommend a honeytone mini amp.
customer_reviews.author: Belva Myers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel guitar
customer_reviews.text: Love this guitar for travel. Fret board is a little tight for big fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron J Cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Me
customer_reviews.text: After looking at many of the travel guitars I decided to purchase the Traveller Ultra-light. At 3 pounds and 28 inches it fits nicely into my 28" rolling airline bag. The quality is excellent. I use it with a laptop computer as an amp while on the road. I am very happy with this Guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Dann Jerrold Immel

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly for what it is desigend for. Sure it does not have the sound of a $3000 guitar, but it never cost that either.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for my travels as it is small package while still playable. Action is a bit high but not a major challenge. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Parris

customer_reviews.title: Traveler light guitar
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, takes some time to get used to playing but very handy and compact. I find I'm playing it more then my full size!
customer_reviews.author: Kerryn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service great product
customer_reviews.text: The research into this product has been realised in the purchase of the product which lived up to it acclaim. My only regreat was not following the Amazon advice and purchasing the amplifer with the traveler guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Kidner

customer_reviews.title: It travels beautifully. Her only suggestion is that the bar that ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife and she loves it. It plays and sounds just as well as as her full size electric. She rarely uses that any more. It travels beautifully. Her only suggestion is that the bar that fits against her leg would better if it were adjustable in/out.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travelling
customer_reviews.text: Since I travel a lot for my job, I wanted a guitar that could fit in my suitcase. And for this the Traveler ultra light is perfect. I wanted the electric model, but it wasn't available, so I got the electro acoustic. I have to say that when I plug it in my headphones amp or my Mesa, the sound is really good even with saturation. I changed the strings to electric model. the only down sides so far (got it 1 week ago) is the G string does not stay in tune. Otherwise, I'm very happy I bought this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Alf

customer_reviews.title: great guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I'm a learner and travel a lot and it exceeded my expectations and I love using it and its compact and light to carry .
customer_reviews.author: wayne feutrill

customer_reviews.title: It's So Easy To Manage
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to carry this around without worrying about a thing! It sounds great with any amplification source.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Lynn Locker

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and travels well. No problem with airlines about size or "extra" carry on. Super light, stays in tune. Mine has the simple piezo pickup which doesnt sound as good as fancier pickups, but hardly an issue since it is only for practice while traveling. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift & the recipient loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Was exactly what i expected it to be!
customer_reviews.text: Compact and yet full guitar that i can get anywhere i go. Really awesome, maybe all get the bass guitar :)
customer_reviews.author: jose diaz

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It said it is acoustic-electric, but it is actually electric guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Edward K.

customer_reviews.title: Playable as advertised and I've had no problem fly with ...
customer_reviews.text: Playable as advertised and I've had no problem fly with it in a backpack (it sticks out a bit) and storing in the overhead bin. The downside is it needs a decent headphone amp and the Vox amp I got died in two days. So, until I find a reliable amp I have to grade it as "incomplete."
customer_reviews.author: Fred Woods

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Its pictured with 6 strings but was only ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Its pictured with 6 strings but was only a 4 string guitar/ukulele. The sound quality was terrible when plugged in and its worthless as an acoustic instrument. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Kind of cheap
customer_reviews.text: Just got this guitar, and honestly I was expecting something a little.... well, something worth 300 bucks. It just feels cheap (not sure what type of wood it is, it's like basla wood or laminate or something). Not to mention it's got a nice little MADE IN CHINA stamp on the back (and it feels like it). It rattles a little bit when you play. I'd also be surprised if it stays in tune very well. Ultimately, I wouldn't recommend. There are better travel guitars out there that are probably much better than this one. I've already gotten rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar... Showed up damaged
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar! However, the box showed up destroyed! (See pics). The case is torn and the back of the guitar has a dent in it :( Not what you pay close to $300 bucks for...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Traveler Guitar Ultra-Light Acoustic-Electric Travel Guitar with Gig Bag
product_meta.description: Style:Rosewood| Size:Guitar| Color:Maple| Configuration:Right-HandedThe Traveler UltraLight Steel String is the smallest, lightest full-scale travel guitar ever made. Complete with a Shadow acoustic piezo pickup and a lightweight detachable lap rest frame, the guitar weighs just three pounds and is only 28 inches long. The Ultra Light fits into an included high-quality gig bag that stows easily in airline overhead compartments. The Traveler UltraLight is the perfect solution for players on-the-go and on a budget.
feature_bullets: One-piece maple neck and body with natural finish
Features a Shadow under-saddle piezo pickup and standard 1/4-inch output
Includes deluxe gig bag, limited three-year warranty
Full 24-3/4" scale, 22-fret acoustic/electric travel guitar fits in airline overhead bins

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars189 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
